definition: seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Rice noodles are the most famous snack in Guilin.
sentences.chinese: 米粉是桂林久負盛名的小喫。

sentences.english: Purple garlic of Ying county is famous with its quality.
sentences.chinese: 山西省應縣的紫皮大蒜在國內久負盛名。

sentences.english: The city has long been noted for its perfume industry. Population, 24,553.
sentences.chinese: 該市因其香水工業而久負盛名。

sentences.english: Rice noodles are the most famous snack in Guilin.
sentences.chinese: 米粉是桂林久負盛名的小喫。

sentences.english: In fact, the venerable BlackBerry is currently in a “tweener” stage.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，久負盛名的黑莓目前處在了“中間”階段。

sentences.english: The 20-year-old is a sophomore at the prestigious Royal College of Music in London.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他在久負盛名的倫敦皇家音樂學院就讀二年級。

sentences.english: Vienna is also world-renown for its coffee houses.
sentences.chinese: 當然，久負盛名的咖啡廳也令維也納聞名於世。

sentences.english: Our bean curd processing line is the most advanced and well- know in world.
sentences.chinese: 我們蹬豆腐生產線是世界上最爲先絕的，久負盛名。

sentences.english: Lichuan belonged to Ba country in ancient times and had a long history in producing green tea .
sentences.chinese: 利川古屬巴國，產茶歷史悠久，真香茶久負盛名。

sentences.english: Pome for the large, mainly white areas in Shenyang, has long enjoyed a good reputation pepper.
sentences.chinese: 梨果爲大宗，主要分佈在陽白地區，花椒也久負盛名。
